alert.note: Alert for Canon City Vicinity, Eastern Fremont County; Central Chaffee County Below 9000 Ft; Eastern Sawatch Mountains above 11000 Ft; Leadville Vicinity, Lake County Below 11000 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Above 11000 Ft; Walsenburg Vicinity, Upper Huerfano River Basin Below 7500 Ft; Western Chaffee County Between 9000 and 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 20 at 4:26PM MDT until May 21 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...HEAVY, WET SNOW EXPECTED TO OVERSPREAD THE SOUTHEAST AND CENTRAL COLORADO MOUNTAINS, AS WELL AS THE INTERSTATE-25 CORRIDOR, THROUGH TONIGHT... .Heavy, wet snow will spread south across the central and southeast Colorado mountains, as well as the Interstate-25 corridor, through this evening, and then continue through tonight into Saturday. The heavy, wet snow will have the potential to cause damage to trees and power lines. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, except 3 to 6 inches along the Interstate-25 corridor. Wind gusts over complex terrain may have wind gusts up to 35 to 40 mph are possible. * WHERE...Portions of the Continental Divide region, southern parts of the southeast Colorado Mountains, and the Interstate-25 corridor in Pueblo and Huerfano Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 PM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Heavy, wet snow could cause damage to trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For elevations below 5000 feet including eastern portions of the Pueblo area, snow accumulations are forecast to be lighter, generally 4 inches or less. Also, overnight lows tonight are expected to fall below freezing across portions of Pueblo and Huerfano Counties. Take precautions to protect tender vegetation as well as exposed irrigation systems to prevent damage.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
